medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Approximately 10 years prior to the current evaluation, the patient had been diagnosed with prostate adenocarcinoma and treated with brachytherapy. Microscopic hematuria was noted about 6 months before the current evaluation, which was followed by an episode of gross hematuria two months later. The patient reported no pain or other genitourinary symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Nonâ€“insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, cold-induced asthma, and a history of myocardial infarction.
medical_history.family_history: His mother had died of cancer; his father and six older siblings are well. There was no family history of prostate or urethral cancer.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is retired, had no history of occupational exposures, has never married, has no children, and is not sexually active. He does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
